title.native: アニメ モンスターストライク

description:
The lonely dragon Oragon is called upon to help save the Strike World from annihilation and hear tales of the legendary monsters that will help him, including the fallen angel Lucifer, the Knight of Knights Arthur, the mage princess Solomon, and more. Features a storyline unrelated to the previous Monster Strike the Animation seasons. Various stories featuring monster characters from the Monster Strike mobile game are presented in an omnibus format.

(Source: Official YouTube channel, edited)

Includes Episode 0.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

title.native: モンスターストライク
モンスターストライク THE MOVIE ルシファー 絶望の夜明け

node.description:
__[Website](https://www.lellelelle.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lellellelle)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC00BUpKBfL2RX1-x1riRPWg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1cIkRbWmiqwJa7czCF3Qdf?si=NW1vnj-jTYa9IzJR6NXdug)__

__Introduction:__
Lelle is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label Victor Entertainment (2020–), having previously been under Village Gain Association and 88Music (2018-2019). The band combines unique melody with high tone vocals, electro sound and violin to create their special sound. Appearing at "METROCK 2019", "JOIN ALIVE 2019", "PIA MUSIC COMPLEX" and other large festivals has drawn a lot of attention to the band, giving them sizeable recognition in a short span of time.

__Biography:__
Lelle originally formed in 2013, with the core members Kentarou Sakurai and Ryou Endou. The third member saya joined a bit later, and in August of 2013 the band officially started their band activities.

On September 18, 2019, their first album "Alice" saw its release. The title track "Toki Nari no Machi" was selected to be the ending theme to TBS television show CDTV in September of the same year. Additionally their new song "Kimi Sora" was chosen as the theme song to the final chapter of the anime "Monster Strike The Animation", which initially began airing in June 2018, with the final chapter beginning its release in November, 2019.

On March 4, 2020, the band released their first EP titled "Eureka" through record label Victor Entertainment, which included the title track "Kimi Sora" from the anime Monster Strike The Animation as the main track.

__Members:__
- [Kentarou Sakurai](https://anilist.co/staff/162757/Kentarou-Sakurai) (櫻井健太郎) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- Ryou Endou (エンドウリョウ) – bassist
- saya (さや) – violinist, synthesizer, chorus

__[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kentaro_sakurai_lelle/)__

__Kentarou Sakurai__ is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer and member of the band [Lelle](https://anilist.co/staff/162756/Lelle).

__Biography:__

- [Kentarou Sakurai](https://anilist.co/staff/162757/Kentarou-Sakurai) (櫻井健太郎) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- Ryou Endou (エンドウリョウ) – bassist
- saya (さや) – violinist, synthesizer, chorus

__Kentarou Sakurai__ is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer and member of the band [Lelle](https://anilist.co/staff/162756/Lelle).
A Japanese video game developer and TV show producer. He is best known for directing the live-action visual novel 428: Shibuya Scramble, which is a prequel to the CANAAN anime.
A Japanese video game developer and TV show producer. He is best known for directing the live-action visual novel 428: Shibuya Scramble, which is a prequel to the CANAAN anime.

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. In 2008, he made his solo debut as "Masayoshi Ooishi". His way of playing the acoustic guitar was said to be a masterpiece of its own, and as a solo artist to debut with that as a reputation, it made it all the more interesting for him. There are various ways to describe him as a musician, some call him a "hand magician", or a "one-person amusement park", some even say it's like watching a magic trick. Not only does he perform live at the country's floorboard, he also performs on the internet on sites such as YouTube and Nico Nico Douga, where he attracts lots of attention from all generations alike, but he's a lot more popular with the younger generation.

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

Yuuki Nakamura is a CG director and CG designer and currently director at Studio Anima with Sasahara Kazuya.

Episode 2 - Slingshot Away! Call Me Oragon!
Episode 3 - Aoi Mizusawa's Secret
Episode 4 - A Night At The Colloseum
Episode 5 - Mall Brawl
Episode 6 - The Glinting Blade
Episode 7 - Operation Recruit Akira
Episode 8 - Evil Eye Minami - A mild and ditzy girl? -
Episode 9 - SOS! A Shocking Video?! - If you want to erase it... -
Episode 10 - Shopfront Shocker - Leave this to me! -
Episode 11 - Welcome, Minami! - Enter a new comrade—but she's an airhead? -
Episode 12 - Ora-gone?! - No more secrets. Ora ora ora! -
Episode 13 - Impossible Task - Are they serious?! -
Episode 14 - Izanami - Past despair, there was... -
Episode 15 - Beware the Warrior God - You end here! -
Episode 16 - Counter! A Strike Shot for the Ages! - There's always an answer! -
Episode 17 - Pieces of Memories - We played MS in the past? -
Episode 18 - Where Art Thou, Haruma? - You're not even on the same level. Begone! -
Episode 19 - Lucy the Annihilator - Bow before the lord of the fallen! -
Episode 20 - From the Ring, Hope - A new monster takes the stage! -
Episode 21 - Come One and All: MS Club - Defeat the top four! -
Episode 22 - The Saber Amid the Blossoms - Impossible's just a ten letter word! -
Episode 23 - Dark Usurper Zeus - From the heavens... -
Episode 24 - Melodious Snow Bow - Here's a bow, tied right on your heart. -
Episode 25 - Nirvana, Inferno of War - It's always a party! -
Episode 26 - Assemble, Assault, and Assail - It's always a party! -
Episode 27 - An Accidental Double Date
Episode 28 - Booya! Return to Shibuya - Don't even think about touching Haruma! -
Episode 29 - Alice in a Mad Wonderland - I'll cut you into cute, tiny, bite-sized pieces. -
Episode 30 - The Scarlet Shrine Maiden - Divine words hold great power! -
Episode 31 - Blade Versus Gun - Return to ash... -
Episode 32 - The Flock of Bahamut - One thousand?! -

Episode 36 - The Imprisoned Lily - I will not let you have Haruma... -
Episode 37 - In Darkness, Ryoma - Come to your senses, Haruma Kagutsuchi! -
Episode 38 - The Truth of K - We were friends... -
Episode 39 - Akira and Haruma - I wanted to apologize for that time... -
Episode 40 - Gather in Kaminohara! - You need help? I'm there! -
Episode 41 - Off-the-Charts Performance!
Episode 42 - The Sun Sets on Orochi
Episode 43 - An Offering to Orochi - Dance until you break! -
Episode 44 - An End to the Past - We've been here in the past. -
Episode 45 - World Ender Babel - A despair deeper than death... -
Episode 46 - The Descent of Angels - These memories... they're ours! -
Episode 47 - Ziggurat of Chaos - Feel the pain that I have felt! -

Episode 49 - Karma, Light of War - The memories of humans are so beautiful... -
Episode 50 - Of Light and Flame - Harken the light! -
Episode 51 - [Finale] Strike Shot! An End and New Beginnings - We'll defeat you and reclaim everything! -
Episode 52 - An Encore and Continuance: Pandora's Box
